Europeans stunned and challenged by new US security strategy
subhead: In the document published on Friday, the Trump administration took the extraordinary step of weighing in on the domestic politics of its European allies. Across the EU and in London, reactions remain muted to avoid deepening an already growing rift.

title: Louvre unions call strike over work conditions and need for building repairs
Meta to allow European users to share less data after facing fines, EU says
EU governments back 'return hubs' in tightening of migration policy
subhead: Interior ministers of European Union member states approved a slate of measures on Monday that include the creation of centers outside EU borders for sending away irregular migrants. Parliament must now consider whether to approve the measures.

title: French PM and Socialists raise the stakes ahead of key social security budget vote
subhead: The Assemblée Nationale is set to vote on a key social security budget bill on December 9. Socialist leader Olivier Faure has called for backing the bill. If rejected, there would be major consequences for the country and the prime minister.

title: TotalEnergies makes Wall Street debut, further cementing its American profile
subhead: Shares of the French energy giant now trade on both the New York Stock Exchange and the Paris Bourse as of December 8.

title: Inside a major investigation into tennis match fixing linked to gambling
subhead: Three French tennis players were charged on October 18. They are suspected of having agreed to deliberately lose matches in exchange for money and of encouraging other players to do the same.

'The Voice of Hind Rajab' is more than a film about a child killed in Gaza
subhead: Kaouther Ben Hania's unprecedented work is less a film about Gaza and Hind Rajab, who was killed by Israeli tanks, than it is about our individual and collective powerlessness to stop the horror of mass killings, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: US national security strategy targets Europe and spares adversaries
subhead: The document released by the White House on Friday, in which Washington's traditional alliances no longer entail any real commitment, marks a historic break from the post-1945 era.

title: The lawyer suing far-right French mayors for setting up Nativity scenes
subhead: French courts have repeatedly ruled that installing Nativity scenes in town halls is a breach of the 1905 law separating the churches and the state. Sophie Mazas works tirelessly to ensure the principle of 'laïcité' is enforced.
